alert.note: Alert for Jones; Monroe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Monroe and central Jones Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Wayside, or near Gray, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gray, Bradley, Wayside, Dames Ferry, Round Oak, Clinton, Blountsville and Jarrell Plantation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
